location-header.description: The unique identifier for the newly created resource. Append this ID to a subsequent GET call to view the resource details.

content-type-header.description: Set this header value to `application/json` for the request.
content-type-header.name: Content-Type

details-query.description: When set to `true`, returns parsed rule details for every rule in the rule set for a version.
details-query.name: details

latest-query.description: Returns the latest ACL version for the account. If `true`, displays only ACL versions in `CONFIGURATION` and `DEPLOYED` states.
latest-query.name: latest

sort-by-query.description: ACL version content property to sort by. Either `accountId`, `version`, `description`, `state`, `rulesCount`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`, `createdTimestamp`, or `updatedTimestamp`.
sort-by-query.name: sortBy

sort-order-query.description: The results sort order. Either `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).
sort-order-query.name: sortOrder

value.message: Alias = alias-stats-qa-test-src cannot be updated/disabled. Alias is used in a rule or trust-block for the account C-0N7RAC7

aliasListType.description: Alias list type. Either `SOURCE`, less than 50 source IP entries, `BIG`, 50 or more source IP entries, or `DIPA`, fewer than 50 destination IP entries.

aliasName.description: Alias name needs to be unique to an account. An alias name needs to start with a lowercase letter and can't have any uppercase letters. Allowed characters are letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the alias was created.

entries.description: Entries within the alias. Only allowed values are IP subnets belonging to the account and ISO standard country codes. If a subnet mask isn't included, defaults /32 for IPv4 or /128 for IPv6.

entriesCount.description: Number of entries within the alias.

hasCountryCodes.description: Whether the account alias contains ISO country codes.

isCustomerEditable.description: Whether you can edit an account alias.

updatedBy.description: User who last updated the alias.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the alias' last update.

aliasListType.description: Alias list type. Either `SOURCE`, less than 50 source IP entries, `BIG`, 50 or more source IP entries, or `DIPA`, fewer than 50 destination IP entries.

aliasName.description: Alias name needs to be unique to an account. An alias needs to start with a lowercase letter and can't have any uppercase letters. Allowed characters are letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

entries.description: Entries within the alias. Only allowed values are IP subnets belonging to the account and ISO standard country codes. If a subnet mask isn't included, defaults /32 for IPv4 or /128 for IPv6.

acl-alias-list-response.description: All aliases of an account including the global alias lists.

aliasListType.description: Alias list type. Either `SOURCE`, less than 50 source IP entries, `BIG`, 50 or more source IP entries, or `DIPA`, fewer than 50 destination IP entries.

aliasName.description: Alias name needs to be unique to an account. An alias name needs to start with a lowercase letter and can't have any uppercase letters. Allowed characters are letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the alias was created.

entries.description: Entries within the alias. Only allowed values are IP subnets belonging to the account and ISO standard country codes. If a subnet mask isn't included, defaults /32 for IPv4 or /128 for IPv6.

entriesCount.description: Number of entries within the alias.

hasCountryCodes.description: Whether the account alias contains ISO country codes.

isCustomerEditable.description: Whether you can edit an account alias.

updatedBy.description: User who last updated the alias.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the alias' last update.

aliasListType.description: Alias list type. Either `SOURCE`, less than 50 source IP entries, `BIG`, 50 or more source IP entries, or `DIPA`, fewer than 50 destination IP entries.

aliasName.description: Alias names need to be unique to an account. They consist of lowercase alphanumeric characters, optionally separated by dashes or underscores. Their names need to start with a letter.

entries.description: Entries within the alias. Only allowed values are IP subnets and ISO standard country codes. IP subnets need to belong to the account. If a subnet mask isn't included, it defaults to `/32` for IPv4 or `/128` for IPv6.

state.description: ACL version state. Either `DEPLOYED` or `DEPRECATED`. Only ACL versions in `CONFIGURATION` state can be updated.

createdBy.description: The user who created the version.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the version's creation.

rel.description: The relationship of the link to the version.

rulesCount.description: The number of rules in the version.

updatedBy.description: The user who updated the version.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the version's last update.

first.description: Indicates if the first page of results.

last.description: Indicates if the last page of results.

numberOfElements.description: Number of elements on the page.

offset.description: Indicates where to start fetching data or how many records to skip.

empty.description: Whether the sorting option is empty.

unpaged.description: Indicates if the results are unpaginated.

empty.description: Indicates that the sort order is empty.

sorted.description: Indicates that the results are unsorted.

unsorted.description: Indicates that the results are unsorted.

totalElements.description: Total number of elements in the paginated results.

totalPages.description: Total number of pages in the paginated results.

deploy.description: Indicates whether the ACL config version needs to be deployed. When deploy flag is set to `false`, a new version is created in `CONFIGURATION` state. When deploy flag is set to `true`, a new version is created in `DEPLOYED` state.

parsed.description: Parsed rule details for every rule.

ttl.description: A rule's time to live data.

single-acl-version-response.description: ACL version and rule set traffic data.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the version's creation.

ruleSet.description: The rules within the rule set.

updatedBy.description: The user who updated the version.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the version's last update.

deploy.description: Whether the ACL config version needs to be deployed. When `false`, creates a new version in `Configuration` state. When set to `true`, creates a version is created in `Deployed`` state.

ruleSet.description: The rules within the rule set.

info.description: Prolexic Network Cloud Firewall allows you to define and manage inbound access control lists (ACLs) enforced at the edge of the Prolexic cloud-based DDoS protection platform.
info.title: Akamai: Prolexic Network Cloud Firewall API

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic Network Cloud Firewall API

POST /upload HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 428
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=abcde12345
--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="aliasName"
Content-Type: text/plain
big-alias-123
--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="ipVersion"
Content-Type: text/plain
V4
--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file "; filename="upload.txt"
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
{…file content…}
--abcde12345--

multipart/form-data.example:
POST /upload HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 428
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=abcde12345
--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="aliasName"
Content-Type: text/plain
big-alias-123
--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="ipVersion"
Content-Type: text/plain
V4
--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file "; filename="upload.txt"
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
{…file content…}
--abcde12345--

aliasListType.description: Alias list type. Either `SOURCE`, less than 50 source IP entries, `BIG`, 50 or more source IP entries, or `DIPA`, fewer than 50 destination IP entries.

aliasName.description: Alias name needs to be unique to an account. An alias name needs to start with a lowercase letter and can't have any uppercase letters. Allowed characters are letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the alias was created.

entries.description: Entries within the alias. Only allowed values are IP subnets belonging to the account and ISO standard country codes. If a subnet mask isn't included, defaults /32 for IPv4 or /128 for IPv6.

entriesCount.description: Number of entries within the alias.

hasCountryCodes.description: Whether the account alias contains ISO country codes.

isCustomerEditable.description: Whether you can edit an account alias.

updatedBy.description: User who last updated the alias.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the alias' last update.

200.description: Successfully updated alias of the account.

value.message: Alias = alias-stats-qa-test-src cannot be updated/disabled. Alias is used in a rule or trust-block for the account C-0N7RAC7
Number of aliases by alias type is above the limit SOURCE set to this account 1
Required part 'file' is not present.
Invalid total entries = 51 for the alias type. SOURCE/DIPA type alias does not allow more than 50 entries & BIG type alias list should have entries count greater than 50 and lesser than 20000
Invalid entries = [abc] provided. IP/Subnet values should belong to the specified ipVersion or DIPA type alias can have only IP/Subnet entries or Country codes are not allowed for SOURCE/BIG lists
Required request parameter 'aliasName' for method parameter type String is not present

get.description: Lists all the ACL rules versions for the account in any state. Use the [Get an ACL version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-cloud-firewall/reference/get-version) operation to get ACL rules for a specific version. Only one ACL rules version can be in `CONFIGURATION` or `DEPLOYED` state.

patch.description: Updates the state of an existing version. Version state change is unidirectional. A version currently in `CONFIGURATION` state can be moved to `DEPLOYED` or `DEPRECATED` state. A version currently in `DEPLOYED` state can be moved only to `DEPRECATED` state.

get.description: Lists account limits for entitlements, aliases, and trust or block lists.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic Network Cloud Firewall API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Account statistics for ACL rules, aliases, and trust or block lists.

disabledCount.description: Count of disabled ACL rules excluding remarks for an account.

enabledCount.description: Count of enabled ACL rules excluding remarks for an account.

limit.description: Maximum number of ACL rules allowed for an account.

disabledCount.description: Count of disabled aliases for a specific alias type for an account.

enabledCount.description: Count of enabled aliases for a specific alias type for an account.

limit.description: Maximum limit allowed for specific alias type for an account.

type.description: Alias list type. Either `SOURCE`, less than 50 source IP entries, `BIG`, 50 or more source IP entries, or `DIPA`, fewer than 50 destination IP entries.

disabledCount.description: Count of disabled trust or block lists for an account.

enabledCount.description: Count of enabled trust or block lists for an account.

limit.description: Maximum number of trust or block lists allowed for an account.

200.description: Successfully retrieved entitlements, aliases, and trust or block lists.

tags.description: Manage ACL aliases used within ACL rules.
tags.name: ACL aliases

tags.description: Manage ACL rules, which define the traffic allowed through the Network Cloud Firewall.
tags.name: ACL rules

tags.description: Provides the list of all the ACL rules for the version number.
tags.name: ACL versions

tags.description: ACL source IP aliases with 50 entries or more.
tags.name: Big aliases

tags.description: View account limits for entitlements, aliases, and trust or block lists.
tags.name: Account limits
